identificationModule.briefTitle: Dose Escalation Trial of CM310 in Patients With Moderate-to-Severe Atopic Dermatitis (AD)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo-controlled, Multiple Dose Escalation, Phase Ib/IIa Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerance, PK, PD, Immunogenicity and Preliminary Efficacy of Subcutaneously CM310 in Moderate-severe AD Subjects.

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a multi-center, randomized, double blind, placebo-controlled multiple dose escalation study to evaluate the safety, tolerance, PK, PD, immunogenicity and preliminary efficacy of subcutaneously CM310 in moderate-severe AD subjects.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The study consists of 3 periods, a up-to-4-week Screening Period, a 4-week randomized Treatment Period and a 8-week Safety Follow-up Period.

armGroups.label: CM310 600(1st)+300mg(2nd,3rd) arm
armGroups.description: 600mg for 1st dose, and then 300 mg for 2nd and 3rd doses, every 2 weeks, SC

armGroups.label: placebo arm
armGroups.description: placebo for 3 doses, every 2 weeks, SC

primaryOutcomes.measure: Safety parameters (e.g., Incidence of AE, abnormal physical examinations, abnormal vital signs, abnormal ECG, and abnormal lab testing)
primaryOutcomes.description: Incidence of AE, abnormal physical examinations, abnormal vital signs, abnormal ECG, and abnormal lab testing.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics parameter: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from 0 to ∞ (AUC0-∞)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from 0 to ∞ (AUC0-∞)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics parameter: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from 0 to t (AUC0-t)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from 0 to t (AUC0-t)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacodynamics parameters: Serum Thymus and activation regulated chemokine (TARC)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Serum Thymus and activation regulated chemokine (TARC), total IgE level and blood eosinophil count (EOS)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Immunogenicity: Proportion of subjects with anti-drug antibody (ADA)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of Participants with anti-drug antibody (ADA)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Preliminary efficacy: Proportion of subjects with IGA 0 or 1
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of subjects with Investigator's Global Assessment (IGA, on a 6-point scale, range from 0-5 point, higher scores mean a worse disease severity) 0 or 1

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Preliminary efficacy: Proportion of subjects with a reduction of IGA from baseline of ≥ 2 points
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of subjects with a reduction of IGA from baseline of ≥ 2 points

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Preliminary efficacy: Proportion of subjects with IGA 0 or 1 and a reduction of IGA from baseline of ≥ 2 points
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of subjects with IGA 0 or 1 and a reduction of IGA from baseline of ≥ 2 points

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Preliminary efficacy: Proportion of subjects with EASI-50
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of subjects with The Eczema Area and Severity Index(EASI)-50 (≥50 percent improvement from baseline)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Preliminary efficacy: Proportion of subjects with EASI-75
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of subjects with EASI-75 (≥75 percent improvement from baseline)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Preliminary efficacy: Proportion of subjects with improvement (reduction) of pruritus NRS from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of subjects with improvement (reduction) of pruritus Numerical Rating Scale(NRS) from baseline; The range of NRS is from 0 (no itch)-10 (worst imaginable itch)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Diagnosed as AD for at least 12 months before Screening, with below requirements: 1)EASI score ≥16 at Screening and Baseline; 2) IGA score ≥3 (0-5 points scale) at Screening and Baseline; 3) ≥10% BSA of AD involvement at Screening and Baseline; 4) Pruritus NRS average score ≥3 at Baseline.
* Inadequate response to topical medications.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Not enough washing-out period for previous therapy.
* Concurrent disease/status which may potentially affect the efficacy/safety judgement.
* Organ dysfunction.
* Pregnancy.
* Other.

locations.facility: Second Xiangya Hospital of Central South University
West China Hospital of Sichuan University

references.citation: Zhang L, Zhang W, Xu Y, Dong L, Sun Y, Jia Y, Li Z, Chen B, Hou J, Zhang J. Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics, Safety, and Tolerability of Stapokibart in Healthy Volunteers and Adult Subjects with Atopic Dermatitis. Adv Ther. 2024 Jul;41(7):2953-2965. doi: 10.1007/s12325-024-02887-w. Epub 2024 Jun 4.
